Link.description: A reference to a web page.

title.description: Title of the link, generally used for anchors (<a>).

href.description: Can be a complete URL including protocol (http/https) or a relative link if it links to https://plangs.page.

kind.description: A link kind helps us quickly find the kind of link we are looking for.

url.description: Full URL for the image, or path if it belongs to https://plangs.page.

Release.description: A release of a programming language.

version.description: Arbitrary version string used by the artifact.

name.description: Name of the release, if there's any.

date.description: Date of the release, if it is known.

keywords.description: Keywords can be used to match against text content.

extensions.description: File extensions supported by the language.

images.description: Logos, screenshots or other images relevant to the language.

isTranspiler.description: Can this particular implementation compile source-code to source-code?

isMainstream.description: Languages like C, C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, etc. are mainstream and production ready.

releases.description: A list of note worthy releases, not all of them. For instance, noteworthy release could be the latest for each major version.
